item.title: Nancy add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Nancy add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Animals are my friends...and I don't eat my friends." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There is nothing I would not do for those who are really my friends. I have no notion of loving people by halves, it is not my nature." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Nancy add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The Christian does not think God will love us because we are good, but that God will make us good because He loves us." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Anyone who thinks sitting in church can make you a Christian must also think that sitting in a garage can make you a car." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "If you treat an individual as he is, he will remain how he is. But if you treat him as if he were what he ought to be and could be, he will become what he ought to be and could be." -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Lou Holtz
item.description: "When all is said and done, more is said than done." -- Lou Holtz

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Einstein
item.description: "Once you can accept the universe as matter expanding into nothing that is something, wearing stripes with plaid comes easy." -- Einstein

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Martha Washington
item.description: "The greater part of our happiness or misery depends upon our dispositions, and not upon our circumstances." -- Martha Washington

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Sue Grafton
item.description: "There's a certain class of people who will do you in and then remain completely mystified by the depth of your pain." -- Sue Grafton

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "Never be so focused on what you're looking for that you overlook the thing you actually find." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Nancy add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Lighthouses donâ€™t go running all over an island looking for boats to save; they just stand there shining." -- Anne Lamott
